channel.title: How the private servers originated?
channel.description: Just out of curiosity how the hell do people rip the private servers from Jagex, like the new 508+ servers, people can't possibly make these files, and this goes for all private servers like WoW servers too, how the hell do people get the files that runescape use to run their servers?

item.title: How the private servers originated?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

It all started with rsc

Read full topic

item.title: How the private servers originated?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:398318”][quote author=Rash link=topic=495453.msg3623071#msg3623071 date=1307599445]

2005 - This is when RuneScape private servers started coming into the cheating scene, the entire movement was lead by Mopar. There was also the RuneScape’s client source code floating around (from mopar) that was 100% deobfuscated (No encryption at all).

Fuckyeh
[/quote]

That is absolutely not true at all. Except that the year was 2005. We all had “100% deobfuscated” clients back then, from the latest release of runescape, generally supplied by Waffendennis. We could edit these as we wished and connect to official runescape servers. Of course there were various cool ‘hacks’ back then that various people posted in the form of tutorials for others to follow, and of course every week when the client updated we had to re-do the variable names and such, just like today. Around that time, I took all of my favorite hacks, like static colors (for SCAR), map lock, free camera movement, HP over heads, mini-map coloring based on level so in the wilderness you know who you can kill and who can kill you before you see them, and put them together into a client I called MoparScape, I also wrote a really crappy, source based updater for this to update it every week. It was very popular with the color based cheating SCAR crowd for the map lock and the static colors, and also with the PKers for all the advantages it gave you.

So when winterlove posted his first server version, and daiki promptly made it at least slightly useable, supporting walking, teleporting, and early banking and such, I made all the modifications MoparScape had on the official runescape version and applied them to the 317 client, with help from various people (mostly daiki) to remove things like RSA encryption and everything else that needed removed to work with the private server. Then I released the MoparScape private server client which got insanely and unexpectedly popular (hence this site less than a year later), while I still updated and maintained MoparScape for real runescape (I called it MoparScape Revolution at a certain point there).

Then as most of you know, Aryan was big as a bot for real runescape, kaitneiks.com shut down, I wasn’t happy with any of the other new forums that started up, I started installed forums on moparisthebest.com, it got big, I updated Aryan for a few months, private servers got bigger and got moved to MoparScape.org, and here we are.

I hope I remembered everything right. Basically, I played a small role in private servers, I wasn’t a very good programmer back then and everything I did was just basically following tutorials or getting help from others.

edit:

Edit: I saw this a few months back, http://rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-[long]-29147.html gh0st has been around forever and can definitely be counted on as a reliable source of information.

That site won’t load, so I looked here:
http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:3vTMknjn43cJ:rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-%5Blong%5D-29147.html+http://rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-%5Blong%5D-29147.html&hl=en&client=firefox-a&gl=us&strip=1

It is also wrong on the 2005/2006 timeline, Kaitnieks.com was shut down within the first 10 days of Jan 2006 or so, or maybe even in 2005, because moparisthebest.com/smf was made like Jan 12th 2006. Also completely wrong about how Aryan ended, there were no lawsuits and even no DMCA notices back then, the developers sabotaged Aryan and got thousands of botters banned, afterwards various people maintained it, some charged money for it (ruler eric), some scammed with it (luke-something), and I always updated it for free and even wrote a completely automatic updater for it (since it had always been at least a partly manual process), it’s actually still where it always was:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/moparsAryanUpdaterV13.rar[/quote]
Thanks for that mitb :).

That is absolutely not true at all. Except that the year was 2005. We all had "100% deobfuscated" clients back then, from the latest release of runescape, generally supplied by [b]Waffendennis[/b].
Finally found out why Waffen is an admin :).

Read full topic

item.title: How the private servers originated?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:10, topic:398318”][quote]
2005 - This is when RuneScape private servers started coming into the cheating scene, the entire movement was lead by Mopar. There was also the RuneScape’s client source code floating around (from mopar) that was 100% deobfuscated (No encryption at all).
[/quote]

Fuckyeh[/quote]

That is absolutely not true at all. Except that the year was 2005. We all had “100% deobfuscated” clients back then, from the latest release of runescape, generally supplied by Waffendennis. We could edit these as we wished and connect to official runescape servers. Of course there were various cool ‘hacks’ back then that various people posted in the form of tutorials for others to follow, and of course every week when the client updated we had to re-do the variable names and such, just like today. Around that time, I took all of my favorite hacks, like static colors (for SCAR), map lock, free camera movement, HP over heads, mini-map coloring based on level so in the wilderness you know who you can kill and who can kill you before you see them, and put them together into a client I called MoparScape, I also wrote a really crappy, source based updater for this to update it every week. It was very popular with the color based cheating SCAR crowd for the map lock and the static colors, and also with the PKers for all the advantages it gave you.

So when winterlove posted his first server version, and daiki promptly made it at least slightly useable, supporting walking, teleporting, and early banking and such, I made all the modifications MoparScape had on the official runescape version and applied them to the 317 client, with help from various people (mostly daiki) to remove things like RSA encryption and everything else that needed removed to work with the private server. Then I released the MoparScape private server client which got insanely and unexpectedly popular (hence this site less than a year later), while I still updated and maintained MoparScape for real runescape (I called it MoparScape Revolution at a certain point there).

Then as most of you know, Aryan was big as a bot for real runescape, kaitneiks.com shut down, I wasn’t happy with any of the other new forums that started up, I started installed forums on moparisthebest.com, it got big, I updated Aryan for a few months, private servers got bigger and got moved to MoparScape.org, and here we are.

I hope I remembered everything right. Basically, I played a small role in private servers, I wasn’t a very good programmer back then and everything I did was just basically following tutorials or getting help from others.

edit:

Newty:

Edit: I saw this a few months back, http://rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-[long]-29147.html gh0st has been around forever and can definitely be counted on as a reliable source of information.

That site won’t load, so I looked here:
http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:3vTMknjn43cJ:rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-%5Blong%5D-29147.html+http://rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-%5Blong%5D-29147.html&hl=en&client=firefox-a&gl=us&strip=1

It is also wrong on the 2005/2006 timeline, Kaitnieks.com was shut down within the first 10 days of Jan 2006 or so, or maybe even in 2005, because moparisthebest.com/smf was made like Jan 12th 2006. Also completely wrong about how Aryan ended, there were no lawsuits and even no DMCA notices back then, the developers sabotaged Aryan and got thousands of botters banned, afterwards various people maintained it, some charged money for it (ruler eric), some scammed with it (luke-something), and I always updated it for free and even wrote a completely automatic updater for it (since it had always been at least a partly manual process), it’s actually still where it always was:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/moparsAryanUpdaterV13.rar

Read full topic

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:9, topic:398318”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=495453.msg3622911#msg3622911 date=1307590024]
kaitnieks farted n shit, the client comes out, he be al leik kol.
and here we are today.

All i know is it started on his website, JME posted a black book or something like that, has a bunch of info.
[/quote]

http://www.runewiki.co.cc/wiki/Category:Black_Book

A cool thread regarding that: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,157245.40.html

As for the origination of private servers, if I recall correctly, the book(s) hardly cover that.

Edit: I saw this a few months back, http://rsbuddy.com/forum/complete-runescape-botting-history-[long]-29147.html gh0st has been around forever and can definitely be counted on as a reliable source of information.[/quote]
yep, thats the one.

item.title: How the private servers originated?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:398318”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=495453.msg3622335#msg3622335 date=1307546055]
long story short:

someone deobfuscated their client (in all my newfaggotry i cant remember who) then winterlove wrote a server that others built upon, and bam here we are
[/quote]How do you deobfuscate?[/quote] http://lmgtfy.com/?q=How+to+deobfuscate+a+java+based+client

Not really that sure how the private servers started, but winterlove wrote the first one from scratch. People built off of that, and people built off those people’s work.

Read full topic

item.title: How the private servers originated?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

One would just analyze the traffic the client sends to a server socket; obviously you’d have to make the client connect to something other than RS2’s official servers.

Read full topic
